content.description:
Taller climbers might find this easier than 11c. Clip the high 1st bolt in overhang.  Climb the overhang using jugs and side-pulls.  Pulling and stepping over the lip of the overhang onto the head wall is the exciting airy crux.  On the head wall, clip the 4th bolt and climb to the anchor. Lower off into the trees. 

  10d variation: after 3rd bolt, traverse rightward and climb over lip of overhang to join Mark Us Dubious below 4th bolt. 

  Any routes setters who want enter the route info on their routes that I posted, let me know, I will transfer those routes to you.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2-bolt/chain anchor.  High first bolt.  After 3rd bolt, some climb far enough left that the 4th bolt cannot be clipped.
content.location: Located on the light-colored overhang before (south of) the Stockyards Main Corral.

content.description: Climb the chossy shelf and clip the high first bolt.  Climb the light-colored overhang using jugs. The airy and exciting crux is pulling over the lip of the overhang and getting set up on the gray head wall. On the head wall, climb easier moves to the anchors up and left.
content.location: Located in the second corral-like area north of the Main Corral. This is called the Wall of the GriGri Sisterhood. About 20 feet right of Emmonjay's Favorite.

content.description: Climb to the left of the bulge.  Climbing to the right of the bulge is easier at 5.7.
content.location:
First route on Right Wall right of the corner route called Corin's Corner.  Climbs on this wall, listed left to right, are: Tex Appeal, Made In Texas, Cowtown, Dallas Route, and Alamo Arete.  This wall is perpendicular to the creek/cove, and has two grooves up at top.  Faces SE, gets morning sun, and is shaded in the afternoon year-round. 

  Any routes setters who want enter the route info on their routes that I posted, let me know, I will transfer those routes to you.

content.description: Climb left of water streak. Look for nice little 2-finger pocket near 2nd bolt. Chossy lower section, but fun moves after high first bolt.
content.protection: 2 bolts, fixed belay.  High first bolt.
content.location: Stockyards Main Corral Left Wall, left of Moe.

content.description: Climb face right of the flake.  Lower part of route has chossy crumbly rock.
content.location: Stockyards Main Corral Left Wall, left of Smokin' William.

content.description: Climb the chossy shelf and clip the high first bolt. Grunt climb the crux overhang bulge and get set up on the gray vertical head wall. Climb less difficult but sustained moves up to anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts, fixed anchor shared with Monkey Lives Here.
content.location: Right of Thieving Monkey, left of The Monkey Lives Here.

content.description: A must-do route for sure.  Climb to the break and the first bolt.  Establish yourself on the undercling and work your way up the flake.
Climb the water streak, with crux at 3rd bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts, fixed anchor shared with Larry.
content.location: Stockyards Main Corral Left Wall, left of Larry.

content.description: Start below the detached roof block up high.  Climb the crack with sharp edges in shallow left facing corner. Traverse left below the scary roof block that looks loose. After clipping the 3rd bolt, pulling and stepping over the overhang to get on the head wall is the airy crux.  On the head wall, clip the 4th bolt and climb left to 2-bolt/chain anchor.  Lower off into the trees.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2-bolt/chain anchor. Trad gear can be placed for extra security.  First bolt is high and committing to clip.
content.location: Located on light-colored overhang before (south of) the Stockyards Main Corral.

content.description: Start below the left of two grooves at top of wall.  Make your way up to the groove, then up the groove and to the anchor at right.  Anchor is shared with Cowtown.
content.location: Just right of Tex Appeal.

content.description: Climb right of dark water streak, up face to left of groove up high.
content.protection: 3 bolts, shares fixed anchor with Moe.
content.location: Stockyards Main Corral Left Wall.  Left of Curly.

content.description: Climb face left of corner. Crux is last moves to anchor.
content.location: Stockyards Main Corral Left Wall, first route left of Corin's Corner. This wall faces NE, gets morning sun, and is shaded in the afternoon year-round.

climbs.name: Hamlet
climbs.fa: D. Munson, K. Sanders, D. Sanders, February 2003

content.description: Climb the corner.
content.location: Obvious corner maybe 25 right of The Monkey Lives Here, and 8 feet left of Bubbas in Brazos.

content.description: Start climbing The Monkey Lives Here and climb the right side of The Monkey Lives Here flake.
content.location: Right of The Monkey Lives Here.

content.description: Climb up the shelf into the corner system.  Trad gear can be placed in the shelf crack.  There are some loose holds and loose rock on this route, like many POB routes.
content.protection: 3 bolts, fixed anchor. Trad gear can be placed in the lower crack before the first bolt.  High first bolt.
content.location: Located around the corner right, or north, of the Main Corral.  Right of Alamo Arete about 30 feet.

content.description: Climb the face left of the arete.  Pull down on crimpers and small edges and slots past the third bolt to the groove, where the climbing eases off.  Climb up groove and veer right to the anchor shared with Alamo Arete.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 2-bolt/chain anchor shared with Alamo Arete.
content.location: Right of Cowtown.  There are several walls in the Stockyards.  This wall is perpendicular to the creek/cove.  You can see the two grooves at the top, the right groove is directly above Dallas Route.

content.description: Climb face to deep groove near top.  Crux is getting into groove holds.

climbs.name: Cowtown
climbs.fa: J. Forester, M. Harko, D. Michael, December 2002

content.description: Climb chossy lower section thru small roof about 9 feet up, then to slot hold, then go straight up to third bolt and to anchor straight above.  Crux (11b?) is on crimpers and small slots between second and third bolts.  Holds out left in groove make the rating ease off to 10d.
content.location: Right of Made In Texas.  Goes up between the two grooves high up.

content.description: Climb the corner, stemming on both walls.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 2-bolt anchor.  This route can be trad climbed.
content.location: In the corner separating Stockyards Main Corral Left Wall from Right Wall.  It is a 90-degree corner with a crack, and fairly flat and vertical walls on both sides.  Left Wall is much longer than Right Wall.

content.description: Climb the break to the first bolt.  Follow the steep jugs to hard face climbing.  Very sequential.

climbs.name: Bad News Flake
climbs.fa: D. Munson, K. Sanders, D. Sanders

content.description: Crux is between 1st and 2nd bolt.  After third bolt, veer right to anchor.
content.location: Just right of Fickle Finger of Fate.

content.description: Start on the right side of the obvious arete, where the first crux is a super-fun V2/3 boulder problem.  Surmount to the ledge for a no-hands rest before hopping onto the juggy face.  The second crux comes at the obvious protruding horn, where a slick high foot OR an awkward grunting leg-hook lurch may win the day.  Finish by turning the corner at the top under the roof.
content.protection: 4 bolts and fixed anchors (shared with Dallas Route)
content.location: Just to the right of Dallas Route.

content.description:
Climb face. 5.8 or 5.9. 

  Any routes setters who want enter the route info on their routes that I posted, let me know, I will transfer those routes to you.
content.location: Right of Bad News Flake.

content.description: Shaded in the afternoon.  Good for escaping the heat unless the creek is dry.  Then it's like hot but still shaded.
